storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view a summary dashboard of my task statuses and comments to manage workload effectively

testCases.title: Verify dashboard displays task status counts
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has at least one task assigned in various statuses (e.g., To Do, In Progress, Completed)
Database contains task records associated with the employee
Dashboard API endpoint GET /api/dashboard/tasks-summary is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the system login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials (username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted and login button is enabled

steps.action: Click the login button
steps.expectedResult: System authenticates the user and redirects to the dashboard page

steps.action: Observe the dashboard page load time
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads completely within 3 seconds

steps.action: Locate the task status summary section on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Task status summary section is visible and clearly labeled

steps.action: Review the task counts displayed for each status category (e.g., To Do, In Progress, Completed, Blocked)
steps.expectedResult: Task counts are displayed correctly for each status, matching the actual number of tasks assigned to the employee in each status category

steps.action: Verify that only tasks assigned to the logged-in employee are counted
steps.expectedResult: Task counts reflect only the employee's assigned tasks, not tasks belonging to other employees

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the system
Dashboard displays accurate task status counts
No errors or warnings are displayed
Session is active for further navigation

testCases.title: Verify recent comments are shown on dashboard
preconditions: Employee account exists and is authenticated in the system
Employee has tasks with recent comments posted by self or other users
Comments table contains at least 3-5 recent comments related to employee's tasks
Dashboard is accessible and displays the comments section
Comments are timestamped and sorted by most recent first

steps.action: Navigate to the employee dashboard after successful login
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard page loads and displays all sections including comments section

steps.action: Locate the recent comments section on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Recent comments section is visible with a clear heading (e.g., 'Recent Comments' or 'Latest Activity')

steps.action: Review the comments displayed in the comments section
steps.expectedResult: Recent comments related to the employee's tasks are displayed in chronological order (most recent first)

steps.action: Verify each comment shows relevant information (commenter name, timestamp, task reference, comment text)
steps.expectedResult: Each comment displays complete information including who posted it, when it was posted, which task it relates to, and the comment content

steps.action: Confirm that only comments related to the employee's tasks are shown
steps.expectedResult: All displayed comments are associated with tasks assigned to the logged-in employee, no comments from unrelated tasks appear

steps.action: Check the number of comments displayed
steps.expectedResult: A reasonable number of recent comments are shown (e.g., last 5-10 comments) without overwhelming the dashboard

postconditions: Employee can view recent activity on their tasks
Comments section accurately reflects recent task-related communication
Dashboard remains functional for further interaction

testCases.title: Test navigation from dashboard to task details
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system
Dashboard is loaded and displaying task information
Employee has at least one task with a clickable link on the dashboard
Task details page exists and is accessible for the linked task
Browser supports navigation and back button functionality

steps.action: View the dashboard and identify a task link in the task status summary or recent comments section
steps.expectedResult: Task links are visible and clearly identifiable (e.g., underlined, different color, or with clickable icon)

steps.action: Hover over a task link to verify it is interactive
steps.expectedResult: Cursor changes to pointer/hand icon indicating the link is clickable

steps.action: Click on the task link
steps.expectedResult: System navigates away from the dashboard to the task details page

steps.action: Verify the task details page loads completely
steps.expectedResult: Task details page opens correctly showing comprehensive information about the selected task (title, description, status, assignee, comments, attachments, etc.)

steps.action: Confirm that the task displayed matches the task link clicked on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Task ID, title, and details correspond exactly to the task that was clicked from the dashboard

steps.action: Use browser back button or navigation menu to return to the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard reloads successfully with all information intact

steps.action: Click on a different task link from another section of the dashboard (e.g., from recent comments if first click was from status summary)
steps.expectedResult: Navigation works consistently, opening the correct task details page for the newly selected task

postconditions: Employee successfully navigated to task details and back to dashboard
Navigation links function correctly across all dashboard sections
No broken links or navigation errors encountered
Dashboard state is preserved when returning from task details
